qas.question: What state opened the first public university in the United States?
What year was the first public university opened in the United States?
What was the name of the first public university to open in the US?
What is the largest University in North Carolina?
How many students does North Carolina State University enroll?

context: In <a1_0>1795<a1_0/>, <a0_0>North Carolina<a0_0/> opened the first public university in the United States—the <a2_0>University of North Carolina<a2_0/> (now named the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill). More than 200 years later, the University of North Carolina system encompasses 17 public universities including North Carolina State University, North Carolina A&T State University, North Carolina Central University, the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, the University of North Carolina at Greensboro, East Carolina University, Western Carolina University, Winston-Salem State University, the University of North Carolina at Asheville, the University of North Carolina at Charlotte, the University of North Carolina at Pembroke, UNC Wilmington, Elizabeth City State University, Appalachian State University, Fayetteville State University, and UNC School of the Arts, and . Along with its public universities, North Carolina has 58 public community colleges in its community college system.The largest university in North Carolina is currently <a3_0>North Carolina State University<a3_0/>, with more than <a4_0>34,000<a4_0/> students. North Carolina is home to many excellent universities as well as dozens of community colleges and private universities.
